messages.message:
We pretty much already do what they describe here. The Search step in multistep model is:
1. Fetch chunks based on the BM25 index
2. Fetch chunks from vector index
3. Merge, score with gpt-turbo and rerank
I didn't know that we also have BM25 Index -- are we using lucene or somethign built on top of it?

We use this: https://weaviate.io/developers/weaviate/search/bm25
However @Hari and I spoke about substituting it with OpenSearch to have a full fledged search feature once we want to extend to thousands of docs.
Yeah, traditional text search systems that were built around TF-IDF are much more scalable than waeviate. Lucene, Solr, Opensearch, etc.

The hybrid approach is powerful for narrowing down vector similarity. We still think hybrid of these 2 are going to help us power accuracy. While Weaviate supports text search we want to experiment a more proven scalable option for text. Will present all the details on how we are approaching all these options when you are here.

cc: @Atinder @Sławek Biel
@Sabyasachi Roy fyi -- the choice of search systems on vector vs classic text that we had today wrt upcoming search retrieval, indexing implementations for RAG. Also cc @shikhar
@Hari @Sławek Biel @Atinder - let us know as we have more details here so that we can plan the work on the datastores/interfaces that are needed to support this
Sure @sudeep! We are yet evaluate the model accuracy(on scale) on these cases but will give enough heads up if we need this.

Yeah we already run Weaviate, and Opensearch extensively across all of our tenants. As we get more details on usage / designs we can start working out the details on the interfaces/scale/hosting etc to enable product requirements here
Also Opensearch can be very nasty to scale / manage :slightly_smiling_face:
Got it! That’s a very useful info.. Let me setup sometime for us to chat on this.
